bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, June 25, 1941

div1.p: Hench informs Hamer that he never received the material he requested from the National Archives.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to P.M. Hamer, June 25, 1941
div1.opener:
June 25, 1941
Mr. P. M. Hamer, Chief
Division of Reference
The National Archives
Washington, D. C.
My dear Mr. Hamer:
div1.p:
I should be glad to reply to your letter of
June 20, if I had yet had the privilege of receiving the
material that I requested from the National Archives.
I was there about two months ago and those whom I consulted
were to send me the prices of having some material copied.
I didn't get these prices for quite a while. I sent in
my order for them about a month ago and haven't received
them yet. I have no doubt they are very busy but I sin-
cerely hope this material can be hurried along.
div1.closer: Very truly yours, P. S. Hench, M. D. psh:ds
